programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation’s gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Back in San Diego and with Rockfish on the mind, the LK crew fish new grounds and depths to catch these iconic Southern California bottom fish. Along for the ride is pro snowboarder and friend Dave Downing to round out this epic rock cod fishing trip.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Cajun classics are met with a Zimbabwean flair in this delicious mashup of cultures. Join Chef Jay Ducote and Food Network Star Rue Lindsay as they take on the fishing village of Cocodrie, Louisiana. Guided by Captain Zach LeBeouf, this tasty adventure will surely leave you hankering for more.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode of Tidewater Diaries, Captain C.A. embarks on a captivating journey with offshore fishing YouTube sensation Captain Nick Stanczyk of StanzFam, renowned as the "Swordfish King." Together, they unravel the secrets behind Captain Nick's legendary status, sharing thrilling tales of swordfish expeditions on the open seas. The episode not only explores the intricacies of swordfishing techniques but also delves into the rich history of Bud & Mary's Marina. Through a nostalgic lens, Captain C.A. and Captain Nick vividly depict the marina's origins, capturing the essence of its enduring significance in maritime culture.

programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is in Columbia, South Carolina, fishing with Captain Justin McGrady for the elusive freshwater Striped Bass.

programme.title: Captain's Log

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: Primos

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Lake & Jordan head north to Minnesota and Wisconsin to chase longbeards with good friends Joel Nelson and Dave Owens.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s non-stop and up-close big bull action as Team Primos kicks off the 2020 season with an early September hunt in New Mexico. The entire team is in camp and on-point to chase some big bugling bulls. Brad Farris drew the long straw this fall and waste no time heading up the mountain with Will Primos dropping back and firing up the Hyper lip double, Hoochie mama and the bullet bugle elk calls.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Jordan “Big Country” Blissett gets in the driver’s seat for some up-close action—and we do mean UP CLOSE! Brad needs plenty of help packing his bull off the mountain, and Lake is down to a precious few days to hunt before heading off for Arizona.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s T-Roy’s turn to get on the board in New Mexico, but Team Primos runs into an all-day affair with a stubborn bull in his own bedroom. How long will this old boy test Troy’s patience as he waits behind his Mathews bow with Will, Jordan and Slade standing by.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: After coaxing in bulls for Troy, Brad, and Jordan, it’s time for Will Primos to go front and center. With Jordan calling, you won’t believe the opportunity Wilbur has when this New Mexico monster makes his presence known!

The experience shaped the final offerings for this spring and future line plans for our women's fishing clothing.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Experience the thrill of fishing in the enchanting waters of the Everglades alongside the renowned Captain Danny Allen and Captain Leiza Fitzgerald. Embark on an unforgettable journey through the intricate maze of mangroves, expansive marshes, and shimmering backwaters, as these expert guides lead you to some of the most coveted fishing spots in the region.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Join Captain Danny Allen and Dan Benson from Power-Pole as they embark on an exciting fishing expedition in Cortez, Florida, in the latest installment of Beyond The Surface TV. Witness their relentless pursuit of fish as they adapt to the ever-changing conditions. Don't make the mistake of skipping this captivating episode – it's bound to leave you hooked!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Captain Danny Allen and Captain Bill Pitman are two seasoned fishermen who share an unyielding passion for the art of angling. Their extraordinary skills and deep love for the sea have led them to the breathtaking waters of Fernandina Beach , a hidden gem known for its abundant marine life and picturesque surroundings.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Prepare to embark on an awe-inspiring aquatic journey as "Legendary Pursuits: Conquering the Depths of Port Saint Joe" takes you on an epic fishing adventure like no other. Join us as we cast off into the pristine waters of Port Saint Joe, a coastal paradise brimming with marine treasures waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Mike heads to Table Rock Lake to meet up with Trenton and his family. Even battling the tough fishing conditions following a heavy front, there’s never a lack of family time, laughs or friendly competitions with the Southards.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton is headed to meet up with Andrew Norbye on Lake Guntersville in Alabama. With not a lot of current being pulled, the deep schools weren’t set up to feed. So they went up shallow to fish grass until evening time when the ledge fish really started biting.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Rex meets up with “Mr Crappie” Wally Marshall in Texas. Wally takes Rex to one of his secret spots to put the hammer on the crappie. Not only did they catch crappie, but nice largemouth and some top tier coppernose bluegill.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew heads to Rivers Lodge and Hunt Club in Kansas to fish strip pits. Trenton and Rex take on Mike and Nate in a 3 period mini tournament. With multiple species allowed including northern pike, the two teams are neck and neck after the first two periods. Due to bad weather on day 2, period 3 turned into a hour speed round where only keeper largemouth count.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton meets up with Tom Brewbaker as they fly down to Venice Louisiana to fish with Mike Frenette. Mike runs the Redfish Lodge of Louisiana and has over forty years of angling experience. Mike teaches the guys about the local waters including pogey boats and most importantly, world class red fish.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton goes down North Carolina to learn the family secrets of the Forehand family. Ben Forehand is a guitarist for Christian Contemporary artist Pat Barret. When Ben isn’t playing guitar, he runs Wild and Free Outfitters getting people into the outdoors hunting and fishing, getting their minds off of the everyday grind. . Even though fishing is tough the guys build strong friendships and lasting memories.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesn’t hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton makes a trip to South Carolina to fish Lake Murray. He meets up with the Rather Outdoors crew to spend time on the water and at the Rather HQ checking out all the gear from Lews and Strike King.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew is chasing Tarpon in Tampa Florida with Ryan Harrington. After a few close calls and grinding out the long days, they finally catch up to the Silver King.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards continue their family tradition on Table Rock Lake. While they’re there, Trenton spends a day with “Mr. Worldwide” James Watson and learns some things from one of the best anglers on the lake.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: With a free day before Icast. Trenton and Ryan go offshore to try and fill the cooler. Catching a variety of species and hoping to get their hands on a hogfish.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Brian is Joined by Ryan Harder from Zman on an epic 70-mile inshore fishing journey in the Lowcountry, aiming for the coveted inshore slam.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Brian heads to Tuskegee, Alabama to night-fish the home waters of the one and only Mark Daniels Junior.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Brian hosts a championship for his SUF tournament series. Anglers from all over the country will travel to lake Sinclair to compete for the grand prize.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Captain Danny Allen and Captain Bill Pitman are two seasoned fishermen who share an unyielding passion for the art of angling. programme.title: Beyond The Surface

programme.title: Beyond The Surface

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Last August, we partnered with Capt. Moe Newman of Journey South Outfitters to host the AFTCO Women’s Fish Camp in Venice, LA. Nine female ambassadors from various states joined to test our spring women's fishing line, representing both saltwater and freshwater perspectives. The experience shaped the final offerings for this spring and future line plans for our women's fishing clothing.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Mike heads to Table Rock Lake to meet up with Trenton and his family. Even battling the tough fishing conditions following a heavy front, there’s never a lack of family time, laughs or friendly competitions with the Southards.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton is headed to meet up with Andrew Norbye on Lake Guntersville in Alabama. With not a lot of current being pulled, the deep schools weren’t set up to feed. So they went up shallow to fish grass until evening time when the ledge fish really started biting.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Rex meets up with “Mr Crappie” Wally Marshall in Texas. Wally takes Rex to one of his secret spots to put the hammer on the crappie. Not only did they catch crappie, but nice largemouth and some top tier coppernose bluegill.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew heads to Rivers Lodge and Hunt Club in Kansas to fish strip pits. Trenton and Rex take on Mike and Nate in a 3 period mini tournament. With multiple species allowed including northern pike, the two teams are neck and neck after the first two periods. Due to bad weather on day 2, period 3 turned into a hour speed round where only keeper largemouth count.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton meets up with Tom Brewbaker as they fly down to Venice Louisiana to fish with Mike Frenette. Mike runs the Redfish Lodge of Louisiana and has over forty years of angling experience. Mike teaches the guys about the local waters including pogey boats and most importantly, world class red fish.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton goes down North Carolina to learn the family secrets of the Forehand family. Ben Forehand is a guitarist for Christian Contemporary artist Pat Barret. When Ben isn’t playing guitar, he runs Wild and Free Outfitters getting people into the outdoors hunting and fishing, getting their minds off of the everyday grind. . Even though fishing is tough the guys build strong friendships and lasting memories.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesn’t hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton makes a trip to South Carolina to fish Lake Murray. He meets up with the Rather Outdoors crew to spend time on the water and at the Rather HQ checking out all the gear from Lews and Strike King.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew is chasing Tarpon in Tampa Florida with Ryan Harrington. After a few close calls and grinding out the long days, they finally catch up to the Silver King.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards continue their family tradition on Table Rock Lake. While they’re there, Trenton spends a day with “Mr. Worldwide” James Watson and learns some things from one of the best anglers on the lake.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: With a free day before Icast. Trenton and Ryan go offshore to try and fill the cooler. Catching a variety of species and hoping to get their hands on a hogfish.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing

programme.title: Hunting Land Man

programme.desc: A quiet weekend turns into a battle for survival when a logger and his family run into drug traffickers who’ve hidden cocaine in their hunting cabin.

programme.title: Blood Father
programme.desc: An ex-convict fights to protect his estranged daughter from her drug-dealer boyfriend and the cartel that is hunting her down.

programme.title: No Escape
programme.desc: A thrill-ride about what one American family must do to survive when a violent coup overtakes Southeast Asia.

programme.title: USS Indianapolis: Men of Courage
programme.desc: After delivering components for the atom bombs that would be dropped on Japan, the USS Indianapolis goes down in the shark-infested Philippine Sea.

programme.title: Wolf Hound
programme.desc: A U.S. pilot shot down over Germany must singlehandedly battle Nazi troops to thwart a doomsday plot.

programme.title: Emperor
programme.desc: Tommy Lee Jones is General Douglas MacArthur, who tasks one of his men with deciding if Emperor Hirohito should be hanged as a war criminal.

programme.title: USS Indianapolis: Men of Courage
programme.desc: After delivering components for the atom bombs that would be dropped on Japan, the USS Indianapolis goes down in the shark-infested Philippine Sea.

programme.title: Lord Of War
programme.desc: A notorious arms dealer sells weapons to dictators and successfully outruns the law for nearly twenty years.

programme.title: Bangkok Dangerous
programme.desc: An assassin lands in Bangkok on business but finds himself unexpectedly training a young protégé and falling for a woman unaware of his true nature.

programme.title: Kick-Ass
programme.desc: Without any special powers or training, high school nerd Dave decides to take his love of comic books to a new level and become a vigilante superhero.

programme.title: Love Affair
programme.desc: Academy Award-winners Warren Beatty and Annette Bening star in a romantic tale of lovers torn apart by fate.

programme.title: The Killing Fields
programme.desc: The haunting true story of a Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter and his translator, trapped amidst the brutal horrors of Cambodia's Khmer Rouge regime.

programme.title: The Hitman
programme.desc: A cop (Chuck Norris) exacts revenge on those who wronged him by going undercover as a hit man.

programme.title: The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning
programme.desc: This comedy prequel contains wild car chases and crashes, Daisy's hilarious hijinks, and a bevy of laughs.

programme.title: Three To Tango
programme.desc: An architect pretends to be gay to win a job opportunity, but the ploy may cause him to lose his ideal woman.

programme.title: Monkey Trouble
programme.desc: Eva's (Thora Birch) mom (Mimi Rodgers) is obsessively neat; her dad's (Christopher McDonald) allergic to fur. But when a thieving organ grinder's (Harvey Keitel) monkey escapes, Eva bonds with a new friend. As much as she tries, Eva can't housebreak her new pet ... or break him of his training to steal. And Eva's getting the blame in this heartwarming family comedy.

programme.title: Surf Ninjas
programme.desc: Two surfer dudes discover they are princes of a small South Pacific island and are destined to save their native land from a cruel despot.

programme.title: Suburban Commando
programme.desc: Forced to take a vacation in a quiet American suburb, an intergalactic warrior must protect his new human friends when bounty hunters track him down.

programme.title: Best Friends
programme.desc: Goldie Hawn and Burt Reynolds star as two screenwriters who face chaos after meeting each other's families.

programme.title: Disorderlies
programme.desc: Three friends must save a wealthy, ailing curmudgeon from the morbid plans of the man's greedy nephew.

programme.title: Hot to Trot
programme.desc: A hapless stockbroker meets a talking horse, and everything changes.

programme.title: Osmosis Jones
programme.desc: Inside the body of a zoo worker, a white-blood-cell cop and a cold tablet join forces to stop a virulent virus that’s intent on taking over The City.

programme.title: Strange Brew
programme.desc: When a deranged Brewmeister plans to turn beer into a mind-control device, two friends must save the world.

programme.title: True Stories
programme.desc: David Byrne whimsically pays homage to the mythical small Texas town of Virgil.

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Six young urbanites with budding careers and restless hearts share their dreams, their music, and the common courtyard between their apartments.

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Neurotic conman Roy and his protégé Frank find their latest scam disrupted when Roy discovers he has a teen daughter who wants to meet him.

programme.title: Charlotte Gray
programme.desc: During World War II, a young Scottish woman travels to London, then gets involved with the French Resistance while trying to rescue her missing lover.

programme.title: Chaos Theory
programme.desc: An obsessively organized man learns that he’s sterile … and that his daughter was fathered by his best friend.

programme.title: Beyond The Poseidon Adventure
programme.desc: Two rival salvage teams race through a capsized luxury liner to claim a secret fortune aboard the ship.

programme.title: Corrina, Corrina
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg and Ray Liotta star in the story of a maid in 1959 whose care for a widower and his daughter leads to racial backlash of their love.

programme.title: Critters
programme.desc: After escaping from a maximum-security prison asteroid, a band of extraterrestrial flesh-eating criminals unwittingly land on planet Earth.

programme.title: Critters 2: The Main Course
programme.desc: When two men find a bunch of exotic eggs, the critters soon hatch and unleash a hungry horde of ugly little monsters on their small Kansas town.

programme.title: Critters 3
programme.desc: Let round three begin in the battle for the planet! The flesh-eating alien fuzzballs return to try a whole new fare: city dwellers.

programme.title: Critters 4
programme.desc: This futuristic tale finds spacecraft crew members dealing with an infestation of furry, flesh-eating creatures let loose aboard their ship.

programme.title: Dungeons & Dragons
programme.desc: When the evil returns years later to avenge what transpired in Izmer, five adventurers and thieves must thwart the traps, ghouls and armies of hell.

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: King Arthur's Camelot experienced battles, courage, and love that brought the kingdom to its knees. Along with the passion that made it live forever.

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: A successful attorney fights back against the law firm that fired him after his colleagues learned he was gay and suffering from the AIDS virus.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: The Incredible Journey of Doctor Meg Laurel
programme.desc: An intrepid young doctor returns to her roots to open a practice in Appalachia, where her modern medicine clashes with the locals’ home-spun remedies.

programme.title: Emma's Chance
programme.desc: While doing community service at a horse rescue ranch, a girl forms an unlikely bond with an abused stallion that will not let anyone else ride him.

programme.title: Little Secrets
programme.desc: A pre-teen violin virtuoso tries to fund her dreams by setting up a booth in her backyard where she hears and keeps young people’s deepest secrets.

programme.title: Annie: A Royal Adventure
programme.desc: Annie and her pals go to London with Daddy Warbucks, where they must stop an evil noblewoman's plot to blow up Buckingham Palace.

programme.title: Taking 5
programme.desc: Two nerdy teens fan-out to the extreme and plot to kidnap the world’s most famous boy band to make them play at their school and make them popular.

programme.title: Lost in Yonkers
programme.desc: A film adaptation of Neil Simon's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy/drama that follows the escapades and tragedies of an unusual family in 1942 Yonkers.

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Based on the book The Three Stooges: From Amalgamated Morons to American Icons, this MOW dramatizes the rise of the comedy trio to worldwide fame.

programme.title: The Greatest
programme.desc: Boxer Cassius Clay (Muhammad Ali) trains with Angelo Dundee (Ernest Borgnine), becomes heavyweight champion and converts to Islam.

programme.title: Geronimo: An American Legend
programme.desc: Following the expansion of the United States into the Southwest, the Apache Indians are forced onto a reservation to live out their lives as lowly corn farmers. While many resign themselves to this fate, several Apache, including Geronimo (Wes Studi), refuse to go quietly. Hoping to quell a major rebellion, General Charles Crook (Gene Hackman) dispatches over 5,000 U.S. Cavalry soldiers, led by Lieutenant Charles Gatewood (Jason Patric), to hunt down Geronimo and his men.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: In the 1800s Old West, an unlikely band of misfit friends teams up in a shoot-em-up against a frontier town’s crooked sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain
programme.desc: A stubborn rancher in his twilight years takes on the U.S. government when the Air Force tries to expropriate his New Mexico land for a missile range.

programme.title: Masterminds
programme.desc: A tech geek expelled from school for pulling pranks on staff becomes the one person with enough savvy to rescue students from a gang of kidnappers.

programme.title: Christmas on Division Street
programme.desc: Follows the unlikely friendship between a bullied teenage school boy and the unhomed American history buff he wants to help before Christmas.

programme.title: A Perfect Day
programme.desc: An author discovers fame when his book skyrockets to the bestseller list. He then gets a visit from a stranger telling him he has 40 days to live.

programme.title: The Nuttiest Nutcracker
programme.desc: Young teen Marie falls asleep and enters the magical world of the Nutcracker Prince where, along with some friends, she helps him reclaim his kingdom.

programme.title: Buster & Chauncey's Silent Night
programme.desc: Two 19th-century Austrian mice evade a voracious cat, aid a kidnapped orphan, foil thieves and help create a holiday classic.

programme.title: The 12 Dogs of Christmas
programme.desc: During the Great Depression in a town that has outlawed dogs, a preteen girl puts on a canine-themed Christmas pageant to win over the mayor.

programme.title: A Perfect Day
programme.desc: An author discovers fame when his book skyrockets to the bestseller list. He then gets a visit from a stranger telling him he has 40 days to live.

programme.title: Christmas on Division Street
programme.desc: Follows the unlikely friendship between a bullied teenage school boy and the unhomed American history buff he wants to help before Christmas.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: In the 1800s Old West, an unlikely band of misfit friends teams up in a shoot-em-up against a frontier town’s crooked sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Theodora Goes Wild
programme.desc: Theodora Lynn (Irene Dunne) is secretly the author of a salacious novel written under a pen name. She must hide her identity from the residents of her small, conservative Connecticut town, who disapprove of the book. When Theodora goes to New York to visit her publisher (Thurston Hall), she meets the book's cover artist, Michael Grant (Melvyn Douglas), who tries to convince her to reveal herself as the real author. When Theodora falls for Michael, she soon finds that he has secrets of his own.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finacé, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: Affair in Trinidad
programme.desc: At the cost of damaging her relationship, a club dancer secretly works in cahoots with the cops to extract intel from a gang of international spies.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Convicted
programme.desc: During a barroom brawl, Joe Hufford (Glenn Ford) accidentally kills the son of a powerful, prominent man. The district attorney, George Knowland (Broderick Crawford), wins a manslaughter conviction, despite having doubts about the defendant's guilt. Joe is sent to prison, and George, who eventually becomes the warden there, hopes to get him released. But Joe gets so immersed in the culture and codes of the jailhouse that he finds it difficult to believe in his own innocence.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: Criminals of the Air
programme.desc: An undercover agent is sent to a border town to break up a well-organized band of smugglers.

programme.title: Diamond Head
programme.desc: A wealthy Hawaiian pineapple plantation owner and bigoted bully with political ambitions flatly refuses to allow his young sister to marry a native.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: A butler becomes a king after a shipwreck.

programme.title: Baby the Rain Must Fall
programme.desc: After his release from prison, an aspiring country singer tries to go straight, but his dream of a singing career puts this plan in danger.

programme.title: Brief Moment
programme.desc: Based on a play by S.N. Behrman.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they’re the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: There's That Woman Again
programme.desc: A district-attorney employee worries about his wife's activities as an amateur sleuth.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend’s marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: Riders of the Northwest Mounted
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) and his partner (Dub Taylor) set out on a manhunt.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: A Time for Killing
programme.desc: After Capt. Dorrit Bentley (George Hamilton) and his fellow Confederate troops escape from a Union prison, Maj. Wolcott (Glenn Ford) sets out to recapture the fugitives. As protection, the Southern escapees abduct Wolcott's lovely fiancée, Emily Biddle (Inger Stevens), and head toward Mexico. On their way to the border, they kill a Northern messenger bearing word that the Civil War is over and keep this information to themselves, resulting in more conflict with Union soldiers.

programme.title: The New Daughters of Joshua Cabe
programme.desc: While posing as his daughters, three women discover an elderly homesteader has been falsely imprisoned for murder and hatch a plot to smuggle him out.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: The Doolins of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Old West outlaw Bill Doolin (Randolph Scott) marries a deacon's wife, but his gang will not leave him alone.

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: Two ex-Quantrill's raiders (Audie Murphy, Ben Cooper) join the Arizona Rangers to hunt raiders still at large.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: Up the MacGregors
programme.desc: Gregor MacGregor (David Bailey) is celebrating his upcoming marriage to Rosita Carson (Agata Flori) when bandits, led by the evil Maldonado (Leo Anchóriz), steal the family fortune. Determined to get their money back, Gregor and his six brothers go after the robbers. They run across a dentist and his beautiful daughter, who help them find the gang's hideout and retrieve their cash -- but then Maldonado takes Rosita hostage in retaliation. When Gregor comes to save her, he is also captured.

programme.title: Return of the Durango Kid
programme.desc: A stagecoach passenger poses as a masked avenger to track down the thieves who robbed him and his companions.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: Riders of the Northwest Mounted
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) and his partner (Dub Taylor) set out on a manhunt.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Legend of the Golden Gun
programme.desc: After his family is killed, a quiet, young farmer turns into a deadly gunfighter, dedicating his life to the pursuit of evildoers.

programme.title: Oklahoma Crude
programme.desc: An oil derrick owner in early 1900s Oklahoma, along with her father and a bum, tries her best to keep oil companies from buying her estate.

programme.title: Coupled Up For Christmas
programme.desc: Pretending to be a couple in order to win over their exes, Tiffany and Peter fall for each other.

programme.title: The Fabric of Christmas
programme.desc: Liam, a fireman, and Amy, a quilting teacher, team up to make a Christmas quilt for Liam's sister.

programme.title: A Holiday Homecoming
programme.desc: The residents of Hope, NY come to the aid of displaced foster children after St. Jerome's Home for Children has a fire right before Christmas, and many families find the foster children complete their homes.

programme.title: Christmas Crash
programme.desc: An unhappily married couple is presumed dead after their private plane crashes in the woods, but reconnects as their survival offers a second chance.

programme.title: A Royal Makeover
programme.desc: A royalty expert is tasked with turning an unkempt man into the king he is destined to be—and gets a little more out of the deal than she imagined.

programme.title: The Love Hunt
programme.desc: A real estate exec and a farmer team up to find hidden treasure and love.

programme.title: At Home With Tori
programme.desc: Tori is cooking for girls night and must figure out how to please both of her friends!

programme.title: At Home With Tori
programme.desc: Tori surprises her family with a meal that transports them to Spain.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: Tiny receives notice that his bar will close unless he pays $17,000 and his customers rally around him with a plan to save it; meanwhile Jay's hazing practices start to raise red flags.

programme.title: Waking Up to Christmas
programme.desc: After being zapped by faulty Christmas lights, a workaholic finds herself the lead in an over-the-top Hallmark-style holiday movie.

programme.title: Christmas Casanova
programme.desc: Podcaster Elise partners with Daniyal to create an unforgettable Christmas, but it seems he's wooing the wrong woman amidst the festive chaos.

programme.title: A Royal In Paradise
programme.desc: A successful romance writer and a Prince individually escape to a tropical island only to find each other…and true love.

programme.title: The Secrets of Comfort House
programme.desc: A multiple murder investigation in a small hunting town focuses on one suspect, Wendy Sinclair, who operates a battered women's shelter where each of the victims' wives have sought shelter.

programme.title: A Slice of Romance
programme.desc: When a vice president at a PR firm makes a deal with a coffee shop owner, she ends up getting more out of it than she had initially imagined.

programme.title: A Royal Recipe for Love
programme.desc: When Emma is hired to bake for a royal cake, she finds herself at odds with a Prince.

programme.title: A Mile In His Shoes
programme.desc: Baseball coach Murph needs a miracle to save the team. Pitcher Micky with Aspergers may be the answer.

programme.title: Ivy & Mistletoe
programme.desc: A young woman is determined to get home for Christmas, but gets stranded in a small town during a snow storm. Little does she know that she is exactly where she is supposed to be.

programme.title: A Vineyard Christmas
programme.desc: TV host Heather tries to make the perfect Christmas episode but clashes with the winery owner.

programme.title: Waking Up to Christmas
programme.desc: After being zapped by faulty Christmas lights, a workaholic finds herself the lead in an over-the-top Hallmark-style holiday movie.

programme.title: Deck The Heart
programme.desc: When an EVP inherits a manor, he's expected to host his family for Christmas.

programme.title: Courage
programme.desc: Jason Priestley stars in this inspirational adventure story about courage, love and the power of family.

programme.title: Dance Together
programme.desc: An injured dancer and a shy Deaf girl overcome bullies, disability stigma, and other high school obstacles.

programme.title: Santa's Castle
programme.desc: Based on L. Frank Baum's Christmas tales, this story follows the kidnapping of Santa Claus on Christmas Eve by a group of creatures set on sabotaging Christmas.

programme.title: Christmas Tail
programme.desc: A heartwarming tale of friendship and love as single mom Maggie adopts a Labrador for her son Ethan.

programme.title: A Christmas Truce
programme.desc: An American soldier and a Belgian woman fall in love during a brief holiday truce amid the Battle of the Bulge

programme.title: Christmas By Candlelight
programme.desc: Wellness expert, Juliet, works on Christmas memory candles with boutique store owner Tom.

programme.title: Christmas in Scotland
programme.desc: A designer and wealthy heir must team up to bring holiday magic to a small community, making both realize they wish to spend every Christmas together.

programme.desc: A highly skilled special operations Marine assaults six men in a bar, sending the NCIS team on a city-wide manhunt.

programme.desc: Tammy is reunited with her ex-husband, Ethan McKinley - who embezzled millions in Katrina relief funds - after he's tied to the murder of a crime boss' son.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Lasalle must investigate his former partner in the Vice unit after the NCIS team finds a link between an international drug ring and the New Orleans Police Department; Rita looks into a connection between the mayor and illegal activity in Clearwater.

programme.desc: Pride listens in on a wiretap of Mayor Hamilton; the NCIS team investigates when Navy weapons get stolen in a train heist; featuring musical performances by Sheryl Crow.

programme.desc: Unable to trust anyone in New Orleans, the NCIS team calls in FBI Assistant Director Isler to help expose and stop Mayor Hamilton's sinister scheme.

programme.desc: While Pride remains on probation after his rogue takedown of the corrupt Mayor Hamilton, his team is closely monitored by a strict supervisor; the team must secretly investigate after the FBI takes the lead on a case involving stolen nuclear waste.

programme.desc: The team joins forces with FBI Director Isler after a Russian operative with intelligence on sleeper agents disappears; Tammy partners with former sleeper agent Eva Azarova to assist in the disappearance.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: At Lake Mohave, Nevada, a fisherman stumbles across a human skull; in the North West of England, a husband claims his wife has left him for another man, but no one can find her.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Lexington, Kentucky, a newly wed wife parties like there's no tomorrow, until a body is dumped on a golf course; in Brisbane, Australia, there are fears for the safety of a missing wife.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Poughkeepsie, New York, a police officer discovers his wife is cheating on him, leading to a deadly encounter; in Orlando, Florida, a woman gets herself a boy toy with fatal results.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Pleasant Grove, Utah, a former beauty queen goes under the knife to look sexier for her husband, but the romance quickly comes to a horrifying end.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Alpena, Michigan, a neighborhood recluse winds up dead after developing a special bond with a much younger cleaner who enjoys spending his money.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Livermore, California, a love triangle sets two women on a collision course; a couple rekindles romance by visiting to a picturesque region of Michigan, but only one of them is coming home.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Maryland, a real body turns up after a murder mystery dinner; in Adelaide, South Australia, a love rival winds up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio tries to save Yelina; despite Calleigh's protests, Delko gets involved with his dangerous father.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: As Eric Delko's life hangs in the balance, Horatio finds himself reminiscing about the formation of the CSI team and how its members first met.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio must submit to a gunman's bizarre request in order to save hostages when the lab is attacked.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Team members investigate when a trio of volleyball players suddenly drops dead on the court; Calleigh's testimony against Delko threatens his future with the CSI unit.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When Miami's most-hated man is murdered, members of the CSI team search for the killer and hidden treasure.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The double murder of eccentric widow, Isobel Hewitt, and adulterous doctor, Duncan Goff, lead Barnaby and Troy into finding out more about their personal and private lives in the village of Malham Bridge. While Troy suspects an antique dealer that Isobel befriended is the culprit, Barnaby is not convinced, believing anyone the victims knew when they were alive could have been the murderer, from the doctor's wife to the local owner of a restaurant. Even Isobel's close family and members of a local fly fishing group are suspects as they investigate all possible angles.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Martin Wroath is found dead in his home in Midsomer Worthy, Barnaby is unconvinced that he committed suicide with his own shotgun in an unnecessarily complex fashion. When a second murder occurs on an assault course at a local cottage hospital, in which Wroath was a patient, the detective suspects a link between the two murders, and soon finds a wealth of hatred, jealously and lies, before discovering that rope in the village is mysteriously disappearing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce is taking part in an open-air art class, being held on the village green of Midsomer Florey, when she discovers the body of an elderly fellow student, Ruth Fairfax, concealed beneath some undergrowth shortly after a session. Just as Barnaby begins to learn that Ruth was not all she seemed to be, officers of the NIS pull him off the case. While Troy is allowed to assist them, Barnaby is left handling a local operation into a spate of thefts, yet he decides to continue his investigations in secret. In doing so, he soon turns up armed robbery, unaccounted stolen money, former criminals, and secret liaisons, before discovering that the NIS investigation is not being as thorough as it should be.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At his family home in Upper Warden, arrogant actor Larry Smith is killed, when a summer house he walks in to as part of a promotion for the sequel to his hit film, The House of Satan, is suddenly destroyed in an explosion. His family quickly fling accusations for his murder directly at the residents of rival village, Lower Warden, leading Barnaby and Troy to determine if this is the case, especially when Larry's director, another member of the family, is electrocuted while using an exercise bike. It's not long before secrets, affairs and blackmail begin to surface from within the two villages.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: While Troy assists an attractive wildlife liaison officer with an investigation into the illegal sale of protected bird eggs, Barnaby travels to Midsomer Magna to investigate the sudden death of a man, who apparently drowned himself. While there was evidence he was desperately seeking to avoid bankruptcy, and had visited a local millionaire to get back his money from a scheme he had invested in, a post mortem reveals that he had been murdered. The two detectives soon find their investigations crossing over, when a man found to have an illegal collection of bird eggs, is also murdered, prompting concerns that the millionaire's scheme is being used to defraud many, and that someone is willing to kill to keep the scheme going.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The suspicious death of popular young GP Dr Alan Delaney brings Barnaby and Jones to Midsomer Market to investigate. The detectives are baffled as to a motive for murder - until they consider that the newly engaged Dr James Kirkwood may have been the intended victim. Before long, Barnaby and Jones are heading to Wales - former home to Delyth Mostyn, James's fiancee, to delve deeper into the mystery. There are certainly possible suspects in the murder and attempt on Kirkwood, from Delyth's children, who oppose the engagement, Delyth's husband, and more, as the detectives investigate things, in hopes of uncovering the truth before a major walk is to take place on Mount Snowdon.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the build-up to Luxton Deeping's annual photographic exhibition, a battle rages between the traditional and digital photographers of the pretty village. The dispute seems harmless enough - until Lionel Bell is found murdered in a nearby woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter. Barnaby soon gets to work tracking down the killer, but it seems someone is trying to implicate the detective in the murder. And once he is replaced on the case, finding the culprit seems less likely than ever, as his replacement is more concerned of an upcoming wedding than the investigation. Barnaby is forced to work off the case to uncover who is framing him, and who wants dead other photographers in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Cully's latest boyfriend, Nico, decides to shadow Troy in preparation for a TV role he recently got, but gets more hands-on experience than he expected when investigations into a slashed painting at a museum in Aspern Tallow, a 17th century portrait of Royalist Jonathan Lowrie, are overshadowed by the murder of his descendant, Marcus Lowrie. It isn't long before Barnaby and Troy, with Nico's assistance, find themselves dealing with mysterious, ghostly events, escaped criminals, and a museum trustee who has more to them than meets the eye.

programme.title: Unsolved Mysteries With Robert Stack

programme.title: Van Halen: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: At the height of their success, Van Halen is one of the biggest rock bands in the world, infamous for their excess and raucous live performances.

programme.title: Metallica: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: With a combined fortune of $900 million and being a band for four decades, Metallica is one of the biggest selling heavy metal bands in history.

programme.desc: German heavy metal band Scorpions is one of the most successful international rock bands.

programme.desc: A high wire performer wants Danny to build a bike to commemorate his career and the records he has broken.

programme.desc: Danny impulsively buys a '69 Caddy and falls madly in love with her. Will he sell it for a big profit, or add her to his collection?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is commissioned to restore a family heirloom '67 Ford Mustang.

programme.desc: Kevin and Roli make an unplanned stop to check out a mysteriously small vehicle. And later, Danny gets a call from Rob Zombie who wants to customize a truck for his upcoming tour.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard races to clear a hillside in time to fill four logging trucks; Jay R Harkness fights to control the untethered Tigercat on a steep, snow-covered mountainside; Bucking Billy and his son Hogan battle a forest of hang-ups and widow-makers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Four companies of loggers risk their lives to chop down timber while dealing with mechanical failures, brutal weather and rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: J.M. Browning strives to meet a big deadline; Stump Branch Logging tempts fate by jury-rigging old equipment; Gustafson races the weather to build an access road; Pihl Logging hauls in the forest's cash crop.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers race to stay one step ahead of a storm approaching the Oregon coast; Jesse pushes his crew to meet their deadline; muddy roads trap Stump Branch trucks; Robby battles for control; lumber market slump.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some crews shut down while others struggle to stay afloat after stormy weather arrives with a vengeance; the stalled housing market hits home for the loggers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Two of Oregon's logging giants, J.M. Browning and Gustafson Logging, fight to survive; Jay Browning must make tough decisions; smaller outfits find winning strategies.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The gap widens between winners and losers at the halfway point of the season; Stump Branch tests a dangerous logging strategy; the Pihl men play while the bosses are away; a mistake by the Gustafson crew may end a man's career.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers barely survive in a plummeting market; the Gustafson bosses have a close call; an old hook-tender returns to the Browning team, halting Jesse's rise to management; Pihl loses a crucial member of the team.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Gustafson crew faces a nearly impossible deadline; half the Pihl crew skips work; Stump Branch mistakes and inexperience put profits and lives at risk; Jay Browning makes a troubling discovery about his next job.

programme.desc: Belinda brings in a new assistant; Jason disagrees with Gabe's management style; Mike Papac bring in a long time friend of the family to help in the rigging.

programme.desc: Jason Rygaard races to clear a hillside in time to fill four logging trucks; Jay R Harkness fights to control the untethered Tigercat on a steep, snow-covered mountainside; Bucking Billy and his son Hogan battle a forest of hang-ups and widow-makers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Four companies of loggers risk their lives to chop down timber while dealing with mechanical failures, brutal weather and rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: J.M. Browning strives to meet a big deadline; Stump Branch Logging tempts fate by jury-rigging old equipment; Gustafson races the weather to build an access road; Pihl Logging hauls in the forest's cash crop.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers race to stay one step ahead of a storm approaching the Oregon coast; Jesse pushes his crew to meet their deadline; muddy roads trap Stump Branch trucks; Robby battles for control; lumber market slump.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some crews shut down while others struggle to stay afloat after stormy weather arrives with a vengeance; the stalled housing market hits home for the loggers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.desc: Two of Oregon's logging giants, J.M. Browning and Gustafson Logging, fight to survive; Jay Browning must make tough decisions; smaller outfits find winning strategies.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers barely survive in a plummeting market; the Gustafson bosses have a close call; an old hook-tender returns to the Browning team, halting Jesse's rise to management; Pihl loses a crucial member of the team.

programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An ancient Roman "Ides of March" coin; an original "Mad Max" movie poster; an MGM lion brass knocker.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick drives to Los Angeles to see legendary baseball player Babe Ruth's "called shot" bat; Corey is enthused by a miniature model of Ralph Lauren's Bugatti Type 57SC.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An ancient coin rolls into the shop; Chum unrolls an autographed movie poster for the movie, "Reservoir Dogs."

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller hands Chumlee a $30 bill; Rick considers restoring a spark plug cleaner made by Albert Champion; Rick hires a small team of experts to draw up a value for a Walt Disney-signed copy of "The Art of Animation."

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: After test-driving the infamous O.J. Simpson Bronco, Rick must decide whether to purchase this million-dollar item; a rare silverware set; a 1978 "Star Wars" comic.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is presented with a piece of the heat shield from Apollo 13; a seller brings them a classic 1973 Husqvarna Enduro motorcycle; a customer brings in some original artwork from the comic book "Spider Man."

programme.desc: A chair from the U.S. Senate floor rolls through the doors; a guy brings in a signed photo of NASA's Gemini launch; a man races into the shop with a NASCAR driver's suit that once belonged to Ryan Newman.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team checks out a rare REO Flying Cloud hot rod from the 1930s; Rick and Corey are presented with a well-known Picasso etching called "Poor Roby;" Rick and Chumlee meet a man trying to sell his pair of miniature gold plated pants.

programme.desc: A customer brings in a Confederate Civil War knife; a 1936 Rolex owned by Bernie Madoff; a 1950s arcade bowling game.
